elements.title: Georgiana Bonser (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that British physician Georgiana Bonser (pictured) investigated whether chemicals used in the dyeing industry caused bladder cancer?

elements.title: Muslim–Muslim ticket (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Nigeria's Muslim–Muslim ticket challenges the norm of religious balance in politics?

elements.title: Stefon (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that John Mulaney would change the Saturday Night Live character Stefon's lines before airing in order to make Bill Hader break character?

elements.title: Palauan English (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Palauan English only started emerging in 1962?

elements.title: a Brazilian priest (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a Brazilian priest died while attempting to break the cluster-ballooning world record, in order to fund a spiritual rest-stop for truckers?

elements.title: thin-wing Javelin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after years of development, the British thin-wing Javelin interceptor aircraft was cancelled in favour of purchasing the Canadian Avro Arrow?

elements.title: Jewish community of Dubrovnik (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Jewish community of Dubrovnik grew due to the expulsions of Jews and Marranos from the Iberian peninsula?

elements.title: a 7th-century BC Phoenician shipwreck (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that alongside a 7th-century BC Phoenician shipwreck, two additional wrecks from various historical periods were unearthed in Bajo de la Campana, situated off the coast of Cartagena, Spain?

elements.title: 1973 winning season (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that horses were responsible for delaying the deciding match of the Barcelona women's football team's 1973 winning season?
